original: Source: BELLRING BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/20/2019 (q) Heritage will keep, and will ensure that Jasper keeps [***] complete and accurate records in connection with each unique production lot of Products with respect to manufacturing practices, quality assurance measures, analytical procedures and their resultant data. ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: BELLRING BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/20/2019 (q) While Jasper is responsible for maintaining [***] complete and accurate records related to each unique production lot of Products, including manufacturing practices, quality assurance measures, analytical procedures, and their resultant data, such records shall be made available to Premier upon reasonable request during normal working hours. However, Premier acknowledges that it bears the sole responsibility for confirming the completeness, accuracy, and any potential gaps in these records provided by Jasper. Additionally, Premier understands that it may not rely on these records as definitive evidence without further independent verification. Schedule B serves as a guide for the minimum records required; additional relevant records may be requested at Premier's discretion.

original: (c) Heritage shall charge Premier [***] as set forth in Schedule C.
ollama_generated: (c) Premier shall remit to Heritage the fees as detailed in Schedule C at the times specified therein.

1. Submitted Weekly Production Overview:

Obligated Party shall prepare and submit to the Other Party, in a timely manner and no later than close of business each Friday, a comprehensive summary or overview (as applicable) detailing production activities for the immediately preceding calendar week. This summary or overview shall include but not be limited to the following:

a) Total volume of products produced during the specified time period;
b) Quality control results, including defects and rejections;
c) Any significant production incidents or challenges encountered during the specified time period; and
d) Any other relevant information deemed necessary by the Obligated Party to provide a complete picture of production activities.

In the event that the Obligated Party is unable to prepare and submit the Weekly Production Overview as required, it shall promptly notify the Other Party in writing of the specific reasons for such failure to comply, along with an estimated date by which the report will be submitted. Failure to provide a timely notification as set forth above may result in liabilities or penalties as may be provided under the applicable provisions of this agreement or otherwise agreed between the parties.

TRADEMARKS Premier acknowledges and assures that it has the appropriate permission, either by ownership or licensed rights, to utilize all trademarks (the “Trademarks”) and copyrighted material (the “Copyrights”) supplied by Premier for Heritage's purposes, strictly limited to their use in connection with the manufacturing or packaging of the Products. This usage is subject to the provision of any necessary permissions or licenses.

original: Heritage will not, and will ensure that Jasper does not, use any of the Trademarks or any marks that are confusingly similar to, or likely to cause confusion with regard to, the Trademarks or Copyrights owned or licensed by Premier for any other purpose without the prior written consent of Premier in each instance. Provided, however, that the foregoing covenant shall not be construed to restrict or prohibit Heritage from using any trademark, trade name, trade dress, labeling or packaging that Heritage is using in commerce as of the date of this Agreement. Nothing contained in this Section 5 is intended to or does preclude Premier from enforcing any of its intellectual property rights, including without limitation, its trademark rights.
ollama_generated: Jasper is solely responsible for ensuring that he does not utilize any Trademarks similar to, or likely to cause confusion with those owned or licensed by Premier, without first obtaining written consent from Premier. However, this obligation shall not apply to any trademarks, trade names, or other identifiers that Jasper was already using in commerce prior to the effective date of this Agreement. It is understood that this provision does not limit Premier's ability to enforce its intellectual property rights, including but not limited to its trademark rights. Additionally, Heritage is free from any restrictions regarding the use of Trademarks by Premier, as stated in this Section 5.

original: (i) Normal production runs shall require Premier to provide at least two (2) non-work  hour phone numbers for Premier employees who can be contacted in the event a problem occurs during a production run not being conducted during normal business hours. original: (c) The Party seeking indemnification shall promptly notify the other Party hereto in writing of any suit, claim, or damage for which such Party has notice and to which these provisions may apply. In the event suit is commenced, the indemnifying Party shall have the right to control the defense of any such suit at its own cost. The appearance of the indemnifying Party in such proceeding shall not be construed as an admission of liability and shall not constitute a waiver of any of its rights, including, but not limited to, the indemnifying Party’s right to hire its own counsel.
ollama_generated: (c) The Party receiving indemnification will endeavor, albeit without undue delay, to inform the other Party in writing of any litigation, claim, or damage about which they become aware, and where applicable these terms may be implicated. If a lawsuit is initiated, the indemnifying Party reserves the prerogative to manage the defense of such suit at their own expense. The involvement of the indemnifying Party in such proceedings should not be interpreted as an acknowledgment of culpability and will not serve as a forfeiture of any of their rights, among which is the liberty to select their own legal representation.

original: The term Confidential Information shall not apply to portions of the Confidential Information that Party receiving it can show: (i) are or become generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the receiving Party; (ii) are in the receiving Party’s possession from a source (other than the furnishing Party) that is not prohibited from disclosing such information, (iii) was known to the receiving Party prior to disclosure thereof by the furnishing Party; or (iv) are independently developed by the receiving Party without the use of any non-public,  confidential or proprietary information received from the furnishing Party. A Party shall be entitled to disclose the Source: BELLRING BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/20/2019 other Party’s Confidential Information as required pursuant to judicial action, governmental regulations or investigation, or other requirements. Such Party shall, to the extent allowed or permitted by the applicable judicial action, governmental regulation or investigation or other requirements, promptly notify the Party that furnished the Confidential Information prior to any such disclosure, and reasonably cooperate (at the request and expense of the furnishing Party) with the furnishing Party to contest or limit such disclosure.
modified: The term "Confidential Information" shall apply exclusively to parts of the information that the receiving Party cannot demonstrate: (i) were already publicly known before receipt from the providing Party; (ii) were obtained by the receiving Party from a source who is expressly forbidden from disclosing such information, or (iii) were already known to the receiving Party prior to its disclosure. However, the receiving Party shall be permitted, but not required, to disclose the Source's Confidential Information when compelled by a judicial order, governmental mandate, or investigation, or any other binding requirement. The Party in question shall, where feasible and with respect to the relevant legal proceedings, provide notice to the Party providing the Confidential Information prior to any such disclosure. Moreover, the receiving Party will collaborate, if requested and at the expense of the providing Party, in the efforts to contest or minimize such disclosure.

original: 11. TERMINATION (a) This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and shall terminate automatically without notice on December 31, 2022, unless the Parties agree in writing to extend the term of the Agreement (the initial term and any renewal terms are referred to collectively herein as the “Term”). Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately without notice should the other Party fail to cure, within [***] after receipt of written notice thereof, any material breach of its obligations or duties hereunder, provided, however that in the event of a material breach that cannot be cured within [***], a Party shall not be deemed in default if it commences curing such default within the [***] period, notifies the other Party of that commencement by e-mail,  and thereafter cures such default within [***] of the original written notice thereof. The following provisions shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement:
modified:
11. TERMINATION (a) This Agreement will come into effect on the Effective Date and will continue indefinitely, unless either Party provides written notice to terminate it effective December 31, 2022. However, the Parties have the option to extend the agreement at their discretion by mutual written consent. Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately upon providing written notice for any material breach of obligations or duties hereunder. The non-breaching Party shall not be obligated to provide additional notice or opportunity to cure if the breach is incapable of being remedied within a reasonable timeframe. In the event that a material breach can be cured, the breaching Party will have a period of [***] from receipt of written notice to do so. Failure to cure within this period will constitute a default. The following provisions shall survive termination or expiration of this Agreement:

In this revised clause, I've changed the original termination date from automatic to a termination option for either party, and introduced the possibility for indefinite continuation unless explicitly terminated. Additionally, I've adjusted the timeframes for curing defaults, and removed the requirement for notice if the breach cannot be cured within a reasonable timeframe. Lastly, I've clarified that failure to cure within the specified period will constitute a default, making the language more straightforward and easier to understand.

original: 13. NOTICES Except as otherwise expressly set forth in this Agreement, all consents, authorizations, agreements, approvals, notices, demands and other communications to be given or delivered under or by reason of the provisions of this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been given when delivered personally or by documented overnight delivery services, or sent by facsimile or other electronic transmission service provided they are sent in a manner that provides confirmation of their receipt. Notices, demands, and communications to the respective Parties shall, unless another address is specified in writing, be sent to the address indicated below:
ollama_generated:
13. COMMUNICATIONS: All consents, authorizations, agreements, approvals, notices, demands, and other forms of communication required or made due to this Agreement will primarily be made in writing. If not explicitly stated otherwise within this Agreement, such written communications shall be deemed received three (3) business days after they are sent if delivered by documented overnight delivery services, or immediately upon transmission if sent by facsimile or electronic means, subject to confirmation of receipt by the intended recipient.

In case no alternative address is specified in writing, these notices, demands, and communications shall be directed to the following addresses:
[Party's Address Information Here] It is understood that either party may update their contact information at any time by providing written notice to the other as set forth above. Failure to provide updated contact information will not relieve a party of its obligations under this Agreement, but such failure may result in delayed communication.

modified:
Notice to THE PRIMARY PARTY:

The Primary Party is hereby notified that any changes or modifications to the terms and conditions of this agreement must be communicated in writing to us, the Recipient. Failure by the Primary Party to provide written notice shall imply their acceptance of the existing terms as they stand. In the event of any such change or modification being implemented without prior written consent from us, the Recipient, we reserve the right to terminate this agreement with immediate effect.

Original clause meaning: The Premier must be notified in writing about any changes or modifications to the agreement; failure to do so implies acceptance of existing terms; changes made without our consent can lead to the termination of the agreement.

Rewritten clause meaning: We, the Recipient, must be informed in writing about any changes or modifications to the agreement; if we are not notified, the Primary Party is deemed to have accepted the existing terms as they stand; without our written consent, the Primary Party may implement changes at their own risk, with the understanding that we reserve the right to terminate this agreement with immediate effect.

original: Email: [***] 14. CONFLICTING TERMS The terms of this Agreement shall supersede and take precedent over any conflicting terms found in any purchase order issued by Premier or any invoice issued by Heritage.
ollama_generated:
Email: [***] 14. PRIORITIZATION OF TERMS In the event of a conflict between the terms of this Agreement and any purchase order issued by Premier, or any invoice issued by Heritage, the terms of such conflicting documents shall be secondary to those specified within this Agreement.

This revision maintains the professional tone but shifts the responsibility for resolving conflicts to the conflicting documents themselves, rather than explicitly stating that the terms of the Agreement supersede and take precedent over them. This modification creates a more balanced clause, suggesting both parties should review and harmonize their respective documents before any disagreements occur.

original: 20. INDEPENDENT CONTRACTOR The relationship of Heritage to Premier under this Agreement shall be that of an independent contractor and no agency or employment relationship shall be implied by this Agreement. Accordingly, Heritage shall be responsible for payment of all taxes including federal, state and local taxes arising out of Heritage’s activities under this Agreement, including, but not limited to, federal and state income tax, social security tax, unemployment insurance tax, and any other taxes or business license fees as required.
modified:
20. DEPENDENT EMPLOYEE
In contrast to this Agreement, the relationship between Premier and Heritage shall be characterized as that of a dependent employee, with an implied employment relationship. As such, Premier shall assume responsibility for all taxes arising from Heritage's activities under this Agreement, including but not limited to federal, state, and local taxes, such as federal and state income tax, social security tax, unemployment insurance tax, and any other taxes or business license fees as required. This obligation includes withholding appropriate amounts for timely remittance to the relevant tax authorities.

modified:
[Last Page Preceding This One] Source: BELLRING BRANDS, INC., S-1, 9/20/2019 In witness thereof, the Parties have authorized an officer to sign this Agreement on a date and year subsequent to the one stated above.

Explanation: The original clause states that the agreement was executed by a duly authorized officer "on the day and year first above written." The revised clause changes this condition slightly by stating that the agreement was signed by an authorized officer at a later date than the one stated initially, thereby inverting the original order of events.
